result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy Michael Stodola

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Statewide               EFV signed 11/7/16 - c: DA & SCSO. eif

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Evenson, ADA: Karl E. Anderson, NONA by def. Case called at 4:08. Court reviews file and motion to revoke.  Court receives the report and the register of actions from MN. Court grants motion to revoke. Court revokes diversion agreement. Court authorizes a warrant body only.
to Revoke Diversion Agreement. Filed by ADA Anderson. km

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot, ADA:  Sharon Correll. Randy Michael Stodola pro se. Case called at 4:17 pm. Court reviews file. Defendant makes statement. ADA Correll makes statement. First part of assessment has been completed. Def has been compliant. Address confirmed. Bond continues. km  Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Filed by E. Lopez. Re: attached copy of COMPAS. km
all parties signed this date. c: DA. eif

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot, ADA:  Sharon Correll. Randy Michael Stodola pro se. Case called at 10:51 am. Court reviews file. There is a proposed agreement. Court advises right to Attorney. Def wishes to continue without an Attorney. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one without domestic abuse enhancer, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of count one without domestic abuse enhancer. Court witholds entering conviction in Count one in favor of diversion agreeement. Court advises that the Bond is still in effect. Court requests copy of Compas. Address confirmed. Jury Trial is off the calendar.  Hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 04:15 pm.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot, ADA:  Sharon Correll. Randy Michael Stodola pro se. Case called at 11:02 am. Court questions Def. Def will hire an Attorney if case continues to JT. ADA Correll makes statement. At this point Def continues to waive his right to an Attorney. Address confirmed. km

Pre-trial conference at 11-16-2015 10:30 am.
Final pre-trial at 12-07-2015 10:30 am.
Jury trial at 12-14-2015 08:15 am.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot, ADA:  Sharon Correll. Randy Michael Stodola pro se. Case called at 10:42 am. Court advises Def of right to Attorney. Def wishes to continue without an Attorney. ADA Correll makes statement. There is not an agreement at this time. Address confirmed. km  Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.

-Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Mary S.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: EFV, RPT: Elizabeth Frank, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Sharon Correll,  Randy Michael Stodola pro se. Court questions Defendant, he does not wish to hire an attorney. Court finds Defendant is competent to proceed without counsel.  Defendant would like to speak to the DA's office to try to resolve this. Court enters a NG plea.  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 10:30 am.
